instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.A2338: What is A2338? A2338 is a model number for a 13 inch size MacBook Pro Retina from years Late 2020 M1, Mid 2022 M2 with EMC 8162, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-02020, 820-02773..
definitions.820-02020: What is 820-02020? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PPVOUT_LCDBKLT: What is PPVOUT_LCDBKLT? PPVOUT_LCDBKLT is the backlight power rail that is responsible for creating a backlight o nthe screen. .

threads.title: MBP <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2338</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> - board <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-02020</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No image int.
threads.message:
Hi' everybody. I have a M1 MBP from 2020 with a liquid damage. CL053 <SIGNAL>PP3V3_S2_WLBT_ISNS</SIGNAL> was shorted, replaced and now the MBP is running. I get image on external screen but not on internal. I have tested on other known good display without any image. Testet in known good housing as well - no luck. On the old MB you easily see if it is backlight. But not anymore:).
Any suggestions where to look first? I looked at schematics but I can not find any issues. Thank you in advanced.

threads.title: MBP <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2338</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> - board <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-02020</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No image int.
threads.message:
Missing image and backlight at same time?
<SIGNAL>LPDP_INT_HPD</SIGNAL> goes high?
Do you get any voltage at <SIGNAL>PPVOUT_LCDBKLT</SIGNAL>?

threads.title: MBP <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2338</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> - board <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-02020</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No image int.
threads.message:
Hi again. Sorry i answer you so late but I was out of Office when you wrote.

<SIGNAL>LPDP_INT_HPD</SIGNAL> is = 1.15 v stable
<SIGNAL>PPVOUT_LCDBKLT</SIGNAL> = approx 12 v dropping fast to allmost nothing. Not good i supposeðŸ¥µ

threads.title: MBP <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2338</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> - board <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-02020</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No image int.
threads.message: Check the traces for DP800 and QP801.

threads.title: MBP <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2338</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> - board <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-02020</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No image int.
threads.message: Finallyâ€¦ now it is image, but no backlight. Should I replace UP800.

threads.title: MBP <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2338</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> - board <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-02020</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No image int.
MBP <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2338</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> - board <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-02020</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No image int.
threads.message: Yesâ€¦ still a drop. Slow dropâ€¦ but I can not see failures on the mentioned traces. But something/somewhere it drains for voltage on that line.

threads.title: MBP <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2338</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> - board <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-02020</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No image int.
MBP <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2338</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> - board <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-02020</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No image int.
threads.message:
If starts dropping from 12V, means that UP800 enables QP800 at first moment.
Some problem is detected and is disabled.
Check DP800 and QP800/801.
Be sure all adjacent resistors and traces are good.

threads.title: MBP <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2338</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> - board <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-02020</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No image int.
threads.message: Thank you. I will do it right tomorrow. Thank you very much.

threads.title: MBP <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2338</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> - board <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-02020</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No image int.
threads.message: Hiâ€™ I have an issue on th QP800. The enable pin on UP800 is 1,2 volt. But it keeps shutting down. I need to find a donor and then I will let you know. Thank you 2Informaticos for yiu Gold nuggets until now:-).

threads.title: MBP <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2338</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> - board <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-02020</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No image int.
threads.message:
As per schematic, 1.2V at <SIGNAL>BL_PWR_EN</SIGNAL> is suficient to enable UP800.
GPIO block of <CHIP>U8100</CHIP> is probably powered from 1.8V...
